titles.title: Uchuu Senkan Yamato 2202: Ai no Senshi-tachi
Uchuu Senkan Yamato 2202
Space Battleship Yamato 2202: Warriors of Love
우주전함 야마토 2202: 사랑의 전사들
宇宙戦艦ヤマト2202愛の戦士たち
Star Blazers 2202
宇宙战舰大和号2202 爱的战士们

relatedanime.anime: Saraba Uchuu Senkan Yamato: Ai no Senshi-tachi
Uchuu Senkan Yamato 2202: Ai no Senshi-tachi Soushuuhen

anime.description: Three years after the Yamato`s return from the planet Iscandar. The people of Earth restored their planet with the Cosmo Reverse System, and they signed a peace treaty with Garmillas. In addition to reconstruction, Earth developed a new defense fleet that includes the state-of-the-art battleship Andromeda. The Earth goes down a path of military expansion, despite Starsha Iscandar`s wishes. The Yamato helps accomplish this so-called peace, but it comes at the price of many invaluable sacrifices. The goddess Teresa, who prays for tranquility in space, calls the Yamato to a new voyage. The threat of Gatlantis is sweeping over the universe and approaching Earth. Source: ANN Note: The episodes were split in seven chapters and received a small theatrical release where special limited edition Blu-ray discs were sold. Each chapter had a special theatrical screening with a stage greeting prior to their more large theatrical release.

externalentity.identifier: 宇宙戦艦ヤマト2202_愛の戦士たち

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: new
tag.description: Not based on anything, the story is a new work, usually made up by the people involved in creating the anime. Generally if an original work (原作) credit is given, it will be to the studio, or director, or other members of the production team.

tag.name: science fiction
tag.description: Science fiction stories usually focus on how situations could be different in the future when we are more technologically advanced; due to either our own achievements or having met with other civilizations whom we have learned from.

tag.name: Newtype Anime Award
tag.description: This anime has won 1 or more Newtype Anime Award(s)

tag.name: death is cheap
tag.description: Important characters will have a terrible tendency to die dramatically, but will not, under any circumstances, stay dead. This tends to cheapen the dramatic death of a character to the point of being little more than a flesh wound if overused. If you ever hear passing mention of any form of afterlife in a series, be warned that the value of "dead" has become a whole lot less all of a sudden. Similarly, if the entire supporting cast is being killed off left and right, expect a resurrection by the end of the current arc. This trope became so common in some series that most people are more likely to be shocked if a character does not come back from the dead than when it does.

tag.name: space opera
tag.description: Space opera is a sub-genre of fiction that emphasizes romantic adventures in space. Space opera generally involves large-scale conflicts between opponents with powerful abilities and technology. The genre will often be melodramatic, sometimes playing music that can be nothing short of awesome. Warfare and a battle of wits are usually less emphasized, preferring romance (with exceptions, e.g. Ginga Eiyuu Densetsu). Some space operas tend to be formulaic and sometimes even prosaic, often employing very simple devices and somewhat obvious strategies. An example of this would be the infamous laws of physics in the Macross universe, in which the main male lead will hardly ever get hit in battle.

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

tag.name: death
tag.description: Death is the state of no longer being alive or the process of ceasing to be alive.

tag.name: speculative fiction
tag.description: Speculative fiction is an umbrella genre encompassing fiction with certain elements that do not exist in the real world, often in the context of supernatural, futuristic or other imaginative themes. This includes, but is not limited to, science fiction, fantasy, superhero fiction, horror, utopian and dystopian fiction, fairytale fantasy, supernatural fiction, as well as combinations thereof. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Shima Daisuke
character.description: Shima Daisuke is the Officer in charge of the navigational section on the Yamato. Chief Navigator in charge of navigation, signaling, watch, comprehensive route planning. He is also the helmsman in charge of steering the Yamato. His rank is Air captain first-class, born in Okinawa Prefecture. He was an Air Captain third-class in the 101st regular space division before boarding Yamato, received a two-class promotion to chief navigator when the previous candidate was killed in action in a battle against Gamilas.

character.name: Sanada Shirou
character.description: Sanada Shirou is the Officer of Yamato`s Intelligence section. First mate and technical head. His rank is Lieutenant Commander. He was born in Nagano Prefecture. Sanada Shirou oversees scientific analysis, information analysis, development, and engineering. Other than the technology officer, he also holds the post of first mate to Okita. As a genius who graduated at the top of MIT, his thinking is very logical and his analytical skills are unrivaled at assessing a situation. He advanced to the National Space Defense Academy after graduating from MIT, volunteered for UN Space Command and was assigned to the 9th Strategic Division. He is at the center of the Yamato Plan.

character.name: Tokugawa Hikozaemon
character.description: Tokugawa Hikozaemon is the Officer in charge of the Yamato`s engineering section. Chief engineer. His rank is Lieutenant Commander. An experienced veteran of the engineering operation that supported Okita in the previous inner-planetary conflict prior to the Gamilas war. Served as chief engineer under Okita on the Kirishima, flagship of the 1st fleet, before boarding Yamato.

character.name: Oota Kenjirou
character.description: Oota Kenjirou is an Officer in Yamato`s navigation department. His rank is Ensign (or Third-grade Space Lieutenant). Born in Osaka. His job is to observe and report space weather and the Yamato`s accompanying trajectory information. He has a bright personality and his optimism makes him a mood-maker.

character.name: Hirata Hajime
character.description: Hirata Hajime is the Officer in charge of the logistics section, he is the Chief Purser on the Yamato. He is a Lieutenant (or 1st-grade Space Lieutenant). He is in charge of the logistic section, which manages supplies and material goods. The food supply system (OMCS) is also under his management. He has a calm character, joined the Navy at the same time as Kodai and Shima, and has a friendly relationship with them.

character.name: Hoshina Tooru
character.description: Hoshina Tooru is a member of Yamato`s security section. He holds the rank of Warrant Officer. A Tokyo native. A member of the security division who puts all his trust in his chief, Ito. A handsome, sociable young man who always wears a smile.

character.name: Yabu Sukeji
character.description: Yabu Sukeharu is an engineer serving in the Yamato`s engineering department. His is rank: Petty Officer 1st Class. He is a native of Mie Prefecture. The favorite student of Tokugawa. Served under him on the Kirishima before boarding the Yamato. His ability as an engineer is first-class, but he is somewhat timid and always skeptical.

character.name: Toudou Heikurou
character.description: Toudou Heikurou is a member of the United Nations leadership, he is the Far East District Chief Administrator. General manager of the Yamato Plan Division. He is from Kochi Prefecture. Administrator of the Far East District. Also the chief executive of the UN Headquarters Space Planning Office and the Yamato Plan. Although he is not a military man, he has been Admiral Okita`s friend and confidant for many years.

character.name: Abert Desler
character.description: Abert Desler is Emperor of the Gamilas Empire. Although he is a young and arrogant dictator, he has awoken to the needs of his people. As head of state, he is the supreme commander of the Gamilas military and directs strategic operations at his whim, enjoying it as a game.

character.name: Redof His
character.description: Redof His is the Vice President of the Great Gamilas Empire. Although he is officially no. 2 in the line of succession, he is constantly sensitive to the moods of Dessler out of self-preservation. He is looked at with contempt by his subordinates, who criticize him behind his back as the emperor`s tea server, or a token Vice President. Among the cabinet members, he is unique for being a businessman rather than a military officer. Actually, he keeps an eye on the internal affairs of the empire and supports the nation as an administrator, including jurisdiction of the colonial planets.

character.name: Yamanami Osamu
character.description: Yamanami Osamu is the Captain of the Kirishima, former flagship of the destroyed 1st fleet. He holds the rank of space colonel, first class. He is from Hyogo prefecture. He served as post-captain on the Kirishima, the flagship of the 1st fleet commander, Admiral Okita during Operation M. An able warship commander whom Okita trusts implicitly; a principled optimist.

character.name: Gamilas Empire
character.description: The Gamilas Empire is a militaristic intergalactic empire headed by emperor Abert Desler.

character.name: Reishiki 52 Gata Aratame Jiritsu Mujin Sentouki Black Bird

episode.title: 惑星シュトラバーゼの罠!
The Trap at Planet Stravaze!
Wakusei Stravaze no Wana!
episode.summary: Offloading the 11th planet refugees has become Yamato’s top priority. Meanwhile, Kodai meets with some unexpected guests. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 光芒一閃! 波動砲の輝き
The Beam of Light Flashes! Radiance of the Wave Motion Gun
Koubou Issen! Hadouhou no Kagayaki
episode.summary: The Yamato is met by a massive enemy fleet and must decide whether or not to use their last resort—the Wave Motion Gun. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 死闘・第十一番惑星
Battle to the Death: The 11th Planet Rescue Operation
Shitou: Dai Juuichi Ban Wakusei
episode.summary: The 11th planet has suffered tremendously at the hands of the Gatlantis fleet. As the closest potential responder, Yamato warps in to help. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 激突! ヤマト対アンドロメダ
Clash! Yamato vs. Andromeda
Gekitotsu! Yamato tai Andromeda
episode.summary: Word gets out regarding Yamato’s launch, so Andromeda intercepts. An intense confrontation ignites between battleships that will put the audacity of both captains to the test. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 未知への発進!
Departure to the Unknown!
Michi e no Hasshin!
episode.summary: Preparations to launch the Yamato are a go, but the crew faces some heavy resistance. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 衝撃・コスモリバースの遺産
Shock: Legacy of the Cosmo Reverse
Shougeki: Cosmo Reverse no Isan
episode.summary: Kodai meets with a Gamilan ambassador who informs him about Goddess Teresa. If they want to respond to her ethereal call, Kodai and the rest of Yamato’s crew will have to take an enormous risk. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 緊迫・月面大使館に潜行せよ
Tension: Reach the Embassy on the Moon
Kinpaku: Getsumen Taishikan ni Senkou Seyo
episode.summary: Humanity is walking a questionable path. With the former crew of the Yamato having experienced phantasmal visions, Kodai takes it upon himself to investigate the phenomenon further. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 西暦2202年・甦れ宇宙戦艦ヤマト
AD 2202: Revive, Space Battleship Yamato
Seireki 2202-nen: Yomigaere Uchuu Senkan Yamato
episode.summary: It’s been three years since Earth’s revitalization. With Gamilan assistance, Captain Susumu Kodai participates in an operation to retake a floating continent base that’s been seized by a mysterious enemy. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ヤマト絶体絶命・悪魔の選択再び
Yamato Cornered: Choice of the Demon Once More
Yamato Zettaizetsumei: Akuma no Sentaku Futatabi
土星沖海戦・波動砲艦隊集結せよ!
Battle off the Shores of Saturn: Gathering of the Wave Motion Fleet!
Dousei Oki Kaisen: Hadouhou Kantai Shuuketsu Seyo!
さらばテレサよ! 二人のデスラーに花束を
Farewell Teresa! A Pair of Bouquets for Desler
Saraba Teresa yo! Futari no Desler ni Hanataba o
テレサよ, デスラーのために泣け!
Teresa, Cry for Desler`s Sake!
Teresa yo, Desler no Tame ni Nake!
ザバイバル猛攻・テレサを発見せよ
Zurvival Struggle: Finding Teresa
Zurvival Moukou: Teresa o Hakken Seyo
テレザート上陸作戦・敵ミサイル艦隊を叩け!
The Terezart Landing Operation: Crush the Enemy Missile Fleet!
Terezart Jouriku Sakusen: Teki Missile Kantai o Tatake!
episode.summary: The crew’s hard-fought journey to reach Terezart comes to a head. With heavy enemy presence in the area, Yamato is driven into a corner, and available options are dwindling. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 驚異の白色彗星帝国・ヤマト強行突破!
The Shocking White Comet Empire: The Yamato Rams Through!
Kyoui no Hakushoku Suisei Teikoku: Yamato Kyoukou Toppa
episode.summary: The crew of the Yamato are in dire straits when a supposed onboard spy compromises their location. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: デスラーの挑戦!
Desler`s Challenge!
Desler no Chousen!
episode.summary: An adversary from Kodai’s past forces Yamato into a dangerous game of cat and mouse. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 幻惑・危機を呼ぶ宇宙ホタル
Bewitching: The Space Fireflies Beckon a Crisis
Genwaku: Kiki o Yobu Uchuu Hotaru
episode.summary: The continued search for the planet Terezart leads the Yamato through a strange spatial phenomenon. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ズォーダー, 悪魔の選択
Zworder, the Devil`s Alternative
Zworder, Akuma no Sentaku
episode.summary: Kodai and the Yamato are forced to make a nearly impossible decision. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ヤマトを継ぐもの, その名は銀河
Yamato`s Successor, Your Name Is Galaxy
Yamato o Tsugu Mono, Sono Na wa Ginga
ガトランティス, 呪われし子ら
Gatlantis, the Cursed Children
Gatlantis, Norowareshi Kora
ヤマト, 彗星帝国を攻略せよ!
Yamato, Seize the Comet Empire!
Yamato, Suisei Teikoku o Kouryaku Seyo!
さらば宇宙戦艦ヤマト
Farewell, Space Battleship Yamato
Saraba Uchuu Senkan Yamato
